alert.note: Alert for Northern Saratoga; Northern Washington; Southern Washington (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 7:34PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Saratoga, southern Washington and northwestern Bennington Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 734 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Greenwich, or 11 miles east of Saratoga Springs, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Salem, Hartford, Greenwich, Gates, Porter, Northumberland, Easton, Schuylerville, Rupert, Victory, Argyle, Cossayuna, Smiths Basin, Center Falls, Goose Island, Adamsville, Grangerville, East Hebron, Middle Falls and North Cambridge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Northern Saratoga; Northern Washington; Southern Washington
